summary: This document is a letter from the United States Virgin Islands Department of Justice to Jeffrey Epstein outlining new travel notification requirements he must comply with when traveling outside of the Virgin Islands. The letter specifies the conditions under which Epstein must notify the department of his travel plans.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is the recipient of the letter, which details the travel notification requirements he must follow.

locations: 6100 Red Hook, Suite 83, St. Thomas, VI 00802-1348
keyFacts: The letter outlines new travel notification requirements for Jeffrey Epstein.
Epstein must notify the US Virgin Islands Department of Justice in person at least 21 days prior to any intended travel outside the United States.
Email notification is only acceptable if Epstein is already outside the jurisdiction.
The requirements are pursuant to Chapter 86, Section 1724 (b) of the Virgin Islands Code and H.R.515 - International Megan's Law.
